greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1)=1, if n=(2^k)+1, a(n) = k+2, otherwise a(n) = 2+A000523(n-1)+a(2+A035327(n-1)).
comment: Each n > 1 occurs A025147(n) times in the sequence.
link: Ivan Neretin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: a = {1}; Do[AppendTo[a, If[BitAnd[n - 1, n - 2] == 0, Log2[n - 1] + 2, 2 + Floor[Log2[n - 1]] + a[[2 + BitXor[n - 1, 2^Ceiling[Log2[n]] - 1]]]]], {n, 2, 74}]; a (* _Ivan Neretin_, Jun 24 2016 *)
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Jun 30 2004
ext: Edited and extended by _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 25 2006
